context: You have X_(i) ∼ exp (λ), i = 1, 2, 3 independent. One defines Y = X₁ + X₂ + X₃.
question: The joint density f(x, y) of X₁ and Y is
options: f(x, y) = λe^( - λx)λ(λy)e^( - λy) = λ³ye^( - λ(x + y))
$f(x, y)=\lambda e^{-\lambda x} \lambda \frac{(\lambda y)^{2}}{2} e^{-\lambda y}=\lambda^{4} \frac{y^{2}}{2} e^{-\lambda(x+y)}$
f(x, y) = λe^( - λx)λ(λ(y - x))e^( - λ(y - x)) = λ³(y - x)e^( - λy)
$f(x, y)=\lambda e^{-\lambda x} \lambda \frac{(\lambda(y-x))^{2}}{2} e^{-\lambda y}=\lambda^{4} \frac{(y-x)^{2}}{2} e^{-\lambda y}$
$f(x, y)=\lambda \frac{(\lambda y)^{2}}{2} e^{-\lambda y} \cdot \frac{1}{3}=\lambda^{3} \frac{y^{2}}{6} e^{-\lambda y}$

The probability of a human error at a departure is $\frac{1}{50}$, while the probability, that a mechanical failure occurs is $\frac{1}{500}$, and finally, the probability that an airline departure is exposed to an act of terrorism is $\frac{1}{500000}$. If a human error occurs, then the probability that an air-crash occurs $\frac{1}{10000}$, while the probability, that an air-crash occurs at the occurrence of a mechanical failure is $\frac{1}{1000}$, and finally the probability that an air-crash occurs in the event of an act of terrorism is $\frac{2}{3}$. You can assume that at most one of the three potential causes can occur, and, that an air-crash can always be ascribed to one of these three causes.
question: Knowing that an air-crash has occurred, what is the probability that the crash was caused by an act of terrorism
